column2: The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse each representing one of the four evils: pestilence war famine and death.
Crocodile/Beaver fusion spawned near Betus-Coed lake.
Water dog that kills and drowns victims. Has the mane of a lion webbed feet and its tail has a hand on the end to grab victims into the water.
Winged flying white elephants. Carries the deity Indra.
Light elves beautiful race of angelic elf-like beings Located in Asgard. Minor gods of Nature and Fertility. Can give and take away artistic and musical inspiration.
Body of a bird torso and head of a woman. With an enchanting voice sirens.
A shapeshifting dream demon that appears as a dog cat snake pig or butterfly. Causes sleep paralysis apnea and walking.
Fish-like mosasaurus-type creature lives in rice fields
Giant wolf that roams the barren lands or the Arctic. Amarok hunts alone in the wilderness instead of living in a pack. (Similar to Twilight werewolf)
A race of all-female warriors who once a year abandon chastity to have intercourse with the surrounding cultures. Nine months later they give the boys to the towns and keep the girls.
Long life and immortality
A two-headed snake one at each end with chicken feet dragon wings horns and eyes capable of seeing in absolute darkness. It is venomous on both ends.
Dragon without back legs Can be covered in feathers instead of scales Some have a beak-like snout.
Frog-like humanoid that licks dirty bathrooms if not cleaned properly.
Gods of ancient Celtic people. Their realm is called Annwyn.
Man/fish hybrid (merman) wise when on land looks like a normal human always wears a cloak that looks like a carp fish.
Scorpion-men guardians who warn travelers of danger meant to kill the gods.
Truth and righteousness.
A giant sea turtle the size of a small island that eats unsuspecting travelers on its shell.
Shapeshifting monster that devours unborn babies. Identified by the upside-down reflection in their eyes.
The Atlanteans were an advanced civilization with knowledge of astronomy architecture and more. In some accounts they were scientists and magicians.

column1: Ba Ba Yaga Ba Ba Yuga
column2: Life death strong wind {god?} earth underworld sky domains. Hut walks on chicken legs as it rotates. Human bone gate constantly spinning. House part flies on magic mortar. Witch that eats people.
Tree that grows babies. Eating a baby from this tree supposedly grants immortality.
6-horned bull (2 on the head 4 on the back) with 9 eyes (3 on the face 3 on each side of the back). A sign of good luck for emperors.
Whale skeleton that swims with strange birds and fish bringing famine and death.
Sea dragon so large that its movements cause natural disasters.
Ghost of a dead woman who warns families of a new death due to the shrieking cry of the banshee.
A big black dog shapeshifter death omen invisible sometimes a demonic sheep or livestock moves with a chain-dragging sound.
A snake with two rooster legs in the front wings and the ability to spit fire and acid at its victims. It turns victims to stone.
Serpent-like creature
A giant black cat that attacks livestock.
Giant snapping turtle (Oscar?)
Serpentine-eel dragon with black head.
Egyptian equivalent to the phoenix. Soul of the sun god Ra.

A witch with a blue face and iron claws who haunts Leicestershire at night. She eats young children and animals. Her howl can be heard from 8 kilometers away. She wears a skirt made from children's skin and drinks their blood.
Loves to hide in dark places. Shapeshifters that cause many misfortunes in the home such as breaking things turning food sour or rotten and making the house creak.
Body of a bull head of a lion. Appears only on the Chinese New Year but can be scared off by loud noises and fire (origin of firework tradition?).
Shapeshifting water spirit generally takes form of a large rapture (bird).
Blindfolded and inhabitant of bogs swamps and marshlands ward away children from a worse fate.
A sentient scarecrow that cries like a baby to lure victims then kills them.
Six legs gnarled horns loud noise-causing strangling people and livestock.
Once friendly now hates humans prankster sometimes just straight hostile
Man-eating monster that lives in rivers lakes and swamps of Australia. Howls at night and prefers women and children.
Snow-white bird friendly creature living in the emperor's house. Can take sickness from a person onto itself and fly away. As it flies it loosens the sickness thereby healing the king and itself.
Pure white bird from Roman Mythos absorbs sickness flies away and cures itself comes back and does it all again. Predictor of someone's death.
Giant bat-like man hunts Mayans. (Kills all people) Created to kill wicked people and those who don't follow the Mayan gods.
A creature with the lower body of a dragon a scorpion's tail and the upper body of a female with snakes coiled around her ankles. Her waist contains all manner of beasts.
Upper body of a girl and lower body of a grilse (salmon). Grants three wishes to whoever catches her.

A fusion of different animals. The most famous is the Chimaera an ancient Greek monster with the body of a lion a goat's head on its back and a snake tail. It has dragon wings and breathes fire like a turret.
Ghost of a woman who died during childbirth. Has backward feet and a long black tongue; drains youth semen blood and fertility.
Earth created from the destruction of a large sea demon. Crocodile with toad and fish characteristics. Gods killed it and its head became the 13th heaven midsection earth and its tail the underworld.
A huge Scottish sea monster that shapeshifts into a silverfish and hunts whales.
A creature with the front half of a rooster dragon wings and a snake tail. It spits fire and turns its victims to stone.
A water sprite or ogre who stalks the waters of the River Yeo or Ashburn. This legend is most famous in Kingsbridge.
One-eyed giants with poor vision but excellent hearing and smell. They can mimic others' voices to lure prey. They can be both peaceful and violent.
Giant head with wings that terrorized a village after a man decapitated elders
Beautiful girls' spirits that live under bridges. To pass one must either help them or dance with them.
Monstrous wolf (abnormally fast strong and big think Twilight werewolf)
Ghost of a hanging victim with a long red tongue.
Divine beings or spirits.
Possessed inanimate objects inhabited by nature spirits  not deceased human souls.
Race of dark elves from Norse mythos can't go into light or will turn to stone. Has darker skin. Can cause nightmares and haunt animals into a panic.
Animal shapeshifting bearded man. Causes problems if house is dirty. (Prankster).
House elf small old man. Appears and curses the house (if house not to their liking).
Gangly creature spotted on stone walls
A drum that will resurrect Sir Francis Drake and a small army to help defend England. When England is in dire need the drum will sound. If still needed Drake will resurrect and beat back the enemies.
Marsupial that attacks by dropping from trees and kills travelers.
Headless horseman. Has head in a sack next to the rider and holds a whip made of bone. Monster that the myth of the Headless Horseman is based off of. Horse is also missing a head.
Look over house and yard. Happy & calm generally pay them in shiny stuff and they will do your work for you.
Evil possessing spirit leaves after goal (spirit of dead person with unfinished goals).
Women in swamps that use their large breasts and female body to entice men to a water death in swamps.
Small monster that eats and drains the blood from livestock. About the size of a small dog.

Long-limbed tall thin man (corpse-looking) with a straw hat and a knapsack with human bones in it. If his whistle is leaving he is coming. If his whistle is coming closer he is leaving. Created from a curse placed by his grandfather for killing his murderous father who killed his mother.
An invisible demon with fire hair donkey feet and an unnaturally beautiful human body. It feeds off men's energy similar to a Greek succubus.

Tulpa are creatures that spontaneously spawn from a young child's fantasy. It is only visible to the person who created it. Ewah are dangerous Tulpa that are created from the imagination of a madman. After driving the creator insane it takes on a flesh form and drives others insane.
Monstrous giant with only half a body (why?).
Ancient race from another dimension both good and bad.
Feng (male) and Huang (female) were later combined and considered the king of birds. Males have 5/3 tail feathers; females have 2.
Long eel with a flatter head
Supernatural race of humanoid beings that are direct enemies to the Tuatha DÃ© Danann. Personifies wild and destructive natures.
Tall shaggy monster eats livestock
Long-legged no-armed 'alien?'
Kidnapped children by stuffing them into a pouch and jumping into the sea.
A heavenly bird that has a large size and is often white. Bird body with the head and chest of a woman.
Bird with a golden body ; bright white face; red wings of an eagle. Wears a crown on its head.
Massive skeleton formed from the bodies of starvation victims. Bites off the heads of travelers.
A child-hunting demon that brings death and sickness.
Humble and loyal giant human turns into a giant at will ability to glide
Shapeshifting demon that looks like the last corpse eaten.
Reside in graveyards and feast on human flesh. Love to lure travelers to their death. Females take the form of donkey-legged women to lure them to their death.
Dwarflike guardians of underground treasure resembling little old men with hunched backs.
Man with goat legs and head 'Satan?' carries an axe.
Troublemakers with qualities of malice and greed. They have varying physical characteristics.

A muscular humanoid giant from the island of Alboin (ancient name for Britain) 14ft tall. This monster's kind is said to have descended from demons. Hideous and repulsive draped in animal skins with the strength of 20 men.
Humanoid servant usually used for defense created from mud or clay.
A winged woman with snake hair large teeth and horns. Some myths describe a snake body. She eats humans.
Ogre-like creature that has no nose and is three times as big as a person.
Giant elephant-snake lives in caves.
Nine-tailed fox that transforms into a beautiful woman to entice and consume men's livers.
A creature that appears as a black dog mule or horse with fiery red eyes. Known as 'Padfoot'.
Supernatural creatures that live in trees in Greek mythology. They can transform parts of their tree and have a special relationship with it.
Winged creatures with the body of an eagle and the head of a woman. They steal dead bodies spreading stench and poisoning food into villages. They are another type of siren.
Wholeness and health
A chain-rattling antler-wearing horseback-riding cloaked hunter who haunts Herne's tree and terrorizes people and animals that stray too close.
7ft tall grey-haired glowing-eyed creature
Non-dangerous specter hugs kids and screams into their ear to protect them from harm. Got murdered at night.
Fox spirit that can take many shapes and possesses various powers. Its nature (good or bad) depends on its form.

Invisible never touches the ground if you see its shadow you will be happy for the rest of your days (major serotonin rush in the book only for a short time). If you kill the bird you will die in 40 days.
Gigantic and winged Jinn. Like to live in ruins or mud. Usually evil.
Preys on small children shapeshifter can turn invisible. Home has a glamour that confuses passersby. Listen closely a human-like whistle is made by the creature.
Giant winged eel swims in storms big appetite (eats humans).
Sentient flying cotton roll that suffocates people.
Take form of sandstorms and white camels. Less evil and reveal oasis to travelers. Live in the desert.
Flying hoofed biped blood-curdling scream unwanted 13th child of a witch
Zombie with glowing eyes afflicted by rigor mortis  hops around with outstretched arms. Cursed due to greed in life.
Spirits of immense power that can take the shape of anything. They can inhabit anything as well and can turn invisible.
Spider-centaur-like creature that transforms into a beautiful lady to lure men to their deaths. Created by spiders living for a thousand years.
Giants of Norse Mythos extremely knowledgeable and cunning Can use glamour to an extreme extent.

Monstrous little men who want to be evil but fail. They try to cut down the Tree of Life (which holds up the world) but fail. During the winter solstice they come up from the underworld and wreak havoc on human homes and villages.
Sickle-limbed weasel that can cut off limbs in the blink of an eye.
Walking sentient umbrella with two clawed hands; one leg;  one foot;  a long tongue and one eye. Friendly in nature.
Horn like a unicorn (basically a bigger Rhino) lives in the grassy plains of Persia subdued by virgins and attacks other animals. (Loosely based off of Rhino). Horn became medical properties.
Cat humanoid yokai that eats corpses and appears during stormy weather accompanied by fire and lightning. Carries the wicked to Hell.
Power and just rule
Female house spirit. Makes creepy noises e.g. mice in walls causes sleep paralysis.
Mixture of a hyena baboon and bear. Ferocious carnivore with large high front shoulders (4ft) sloping back nocturnal can stand on hind legs. Reddish hair long feet and known to scalp people.
Shapeshifting black dog that turns into a cat  snake horse  or shrub. Fast and malicious.
Domestic spirits that assist with chores. However if angered they will prank you by hiding things knocking people down etc.
Tusks of mammoth bulbous legs like frogs. Sun kills them so they have to live underground most of the year. Some foolish ones stay out and that's where the mammoth carcasses come from.
An evil sorcerer that turns himself into a lich a creature that is caused by putting the soul into another object. If you find his heart and destroy it he dies.
Giant squid sea creatures scatter and shadow takes up portion of the sea.
Son of Hel Norse goddess of the underworld he is the reverse Santa Claus. He kills and kidnaps naughty children. Usually beats them with a stick.
Enchanting women with backward feet that lure men into the woods
Horse skull-headed woman. Shape-shifts into a beautiful girl to lure men with her charm then tells them something that drives them crazy.
Green dragon mixed with a mule  protective of Catalonia.
Glowing apparition in the form of a ball that leads mortals to their death ghost of a soul in pain after death always found where they died.
Hand of dead inquisitional victim that takes children away if they leave bed
Eat too much fall asleep = sleep paralysis created by a red-eyed lady who sits on your chest and stares into your eyes creepily.
Part man part goat 'Pope Lick?'
A demon with a serpent body who never sleeps. She despises mothers and children.
Winter spirit old man dressed in warm animal fur coat. Using ice axe tests structure integrity of home (attempts to break home).
A dog that never loses its hunt. It chases Temessian for all eternity in the stars.
Little men who are shoe cobblers and hide mounds of gold to keep it safe from travelers. Like all fay if you catch the creature it has to give you a wish.
Shapeshifter (animals plants) protects forests controls forests {old god?}.
Female demon that steals children.
A serpentine mollusk that lives underground and eats victims whole.
3ft tall frogs that walk on two legs
Vampiric dwarf preys on drunk and high dwellers
A human king transformed into a wolf-human hybrid (he does not change back into human form) after feeding his son to the gods. He is the first werewolf.

Gaunt extremely strong ice-blue skin skin so tight around bodies it looks like bones are showing head hung low sullen eyes peer at its victims. Stringy hair falls from the face always smiling and giggling. Long fingernails resembling knives. Tickles its victims.
Winged monster with a long tongue and dangling intestines. Drinks blood and eats human organs.
Diwanta who fell in love with a human hunter. Guardian spirit of a mountain.
Proud and arrogant they are considered the most dangerous type of Jinn. Favored troops of Ilbis.
Small humanoid bulbous-headed creatures mutated due to cannibalism
Little people craft temples and roads.
Small stature people who lived in Hawaii before settlers arrived from Polynesia.
Half human Half fish beautiful and romantic (Irish mermaids can transform into humans) also can bring disaster and foretell disaster. (Like people some good some not so good).
One-eyed one-horned goat-legged hairy spiked back can cause madness blindness and death
A chest that shuts on a wife and traps her. Her soul wanders wherever the chest goes.
Bigfoot of Arizona eats food at camps and throws rocks at its victims to defend itself
Highly advanced scientific race that lives on the moon.
Soul of an unbaptized child. Child grows heavier until too heavy to pick up. Then kills you for your inability to take them to their grave.
Serpentine creature residing in water bodies  capable of controlling weather and assuming human form.
Red-headed dwarf with tail bad luck your way
Long black shadow being that melts into shadows and slides on its stomach like a snake kills. (Slenderman?)
An uncontrollable giant 40ft tall.
A race of giants created from the offspring of fallen angels (Watchers) and mortal women. They are extremely angry and cannibalistic.
Giant beast with immortality that eats humans if traditions aren't kept. Body of a bull head of a lion. Appears only on the Chinese New Year but can be scared off by loud noises and fire.
Ghosts of ancient Hawaiian warriors Nights of Kane Ku Lono Akua or Kaba
Enormous white sea creature eerily resembling a person.
Upper body of a man fused with a horse. No skin only muscle and bone. Hates freshwater.
Wrinkly blob of meat with a repulsive odor. If eaten  grants eternal youth.
Water serpent with seemingly affable flippers along its flank and ominous horns atop its head. Malicious and hunts creatures (even humans) and eats them.
Wicked people transformed into demons with red or blue skin and tusks.
Size of a bear?

Giant sea monster that is snake-like with a head protruding from the water almost 3 meters. Thick fur six legs three dorsal fins and two heads. Each head has a long slimy tongue. Eats victims off the dock summons taps on the bottom of wooden piers. Can swim through snow.
Hunts male loggers or hunters. Vampiric eats and skins victims.
Detached head and organs flying at night seeking blood. Reattaches during the day.
Human capable of transforming into a dragon.
Meteors and shooting stars are witches.
Lion-headed antlers of deer feathered dragon
Winged lions that eat precious metals. One-horned males represent wealth protection; two-horned ones protect Feng Shui practitioners.
Swamp demon ugly old woman with hairy body can transform into a beautiful nymph to lure weak-willed men to their deaths.
Vampiric women with long necks; while sleeping  their necks stretch out. Appears normal when awake.
Demon woman dressed in white creates a dust cloud. Curing scythe cuts off head if questioned improperly. Causes strife to field workers (heat stroke etc.).
Vampiric pregnant ghost who died during childbirth  attacks children and causes suffering to men.
Goat/man/sheep. 'Satan/demon' hypnotizes and leads victims to their death
Cursed people who eat unusual substances like corpses or feces.
Massive bear made of rice that grows by consuming everything.
Cloven-hoofed creature with a bull/horse/deer body a Chinese dragon head and antlers of a deer. Signifies the birth or death of a significant leader; a good luck charm.
Half man half bat
Giant eagle that hunts elephants and other large mammals.
Essentially a Sanzuniao with a specific name.
Fire spirit mesmerizing humans. Created from the ignited blood of those who met tragic deaths.
Three-legged bird. Ten of these birds hold up the sun. Ravens or crows block out the sky at night and eat the grass of immortality.
Heavy-drinking monster with a red face and ape-like body.
Most powerful best shapeshifter usually female and seduces/marries men. Similar to the succubus.
Often thought to be beautiful women or mermaids Sirens are actually birds with female human heads. They lure their victims with song and then eat them when they get too close.
Witch transforms into animals talking to a skinwalker causes them to target you.
Bigfoot-like creature that has a strong repulsive odor
Giant fish-like beast that slides down hillsides and eats everything in its way.
Demon bird reptile hybrid. Mortal enemy to the Dewayo.
Holy devotion serenity and loving kindness
Human-headed lioness. Speaks riddles and if answered correctly will let you pass; if not  it attempts to kill you.
Giant octopus (Kraken?)
Owl-human that drinks blood and eats human flesh. Created when a human sells their soul to the devil (generally female).

Undead supernaturally strong and fast. Came back to exact revenge on the culprit of their death. Goes back to their material possessions or into abandoned buildings. Eats human flesh and drinks human blood.

Sorcerer becomes too powerful for this plane of existence. Looks human for short amounts of time. Generally avoids eating people (usually eats animals and crops) which causes farmers to have a harder time.
Hates bad music and sound. Have poisonized poop. Metal beaks and eats flesh. Loves human flesh.
Demons that crave sexual intercourse and will drain their victims' life force as they engage in the act. They have dragon wings goat horns a demon tail clawed feet and red pink or pitch-black skin.
Forest creature with long fingers and a horn on its forehead. Lures victims and tickles them to death.
Bull/lion body. Has no eyes on its head but two on its shoulders. A mouth with rows of sharp teeth that eats everything that moves.
Zombified girl with severed legs by a train. Dismembers others with a scythe.
A creature with the head of a dog a human torso and arms and a mermaid's tail. Immune to magic they practice powerful dark magic and are imprisoned in Tartarus.
A fox that can never be captured. It is hunted by Laylaps for eternity in the stars.
Yokai with purple skin  a big mouth  eyes in its hands. Eats bones instead of skin.

Ghost that locals claim chases you down Nash Road. Lady grieved by daughter's murder and all she found was a leg. She stitched it onto her body and now is a ghost attempting to find her daughter's murderer.
Zombie-like stiff corpse that steals life force. Hops around with outstretched arms.
Little demonic man that kills if you are out of reach of the creature
A mythological figure or creature that is protective of a certain area.
Fairy that is depicted grotesque and short in stature. Nocturnal creature that emerges from their mounds and breaks into homes when the owner is asleep.
Thick snake-like creature capable of jumping one meter high.
7-headed horse that can fly.
Hairy ten-foot-tall glowing-eyed giant peaceful. Eats deer and elk. Uses bones as tools like foot scratchers.
Chimera with the body of a crab and the head of a bull (oni).
Group of women who choose who can go to Valhalla. They have Pegasi and a cloak that makes them blend into the background.
Possesses a man causing him to waste away and start acting like a cat. Cured by killing and eating another cat.

Frog-like man with a green beard and long hair. Covered with algae and mud on its scales. Reticulated legs instead of hands and a fish tail. If angered drowns people traps their souls in porcelain cups or forces them to be slaves or destroys dikes and other water structures.
Good mind and good purpose.
Visible only at dusk and dawn half-woman/half-cat hunts near the Appalachians. Cat form has six legs
Angels that enforce perfection with winged helmets and beautiful male appearances. They were kicked out of heaven for seeking human brides and introduced makeup evil Nephilim and more to humans.
Taller skinny figure faster than a normal human eats human flesh. If you eat human flesh you become the Wendigo.
Ghostly lights leading travelers to either doom or destiny.
Grows women? ?
Nymph-like creature that looks like a beautiful lady/girl. Causes pure souls to feel beautiful and hear wonderful songs while impure souls feel dirty and may go insane.
Ancient aquatic monster. Giant horned snake measures 160 ft long can suck up its prey up to 350 ft away. Don't anger it.

3ft tall slimy toad creature with suction cup fingers that drain your blood just enough to make you pass out. Then eats you whole spits you out and repeats until you are digested or turned into one of them.
Crow or raven embodying the will of heaven.
Witch manipulates body to transform into a coyote
Bipedal ape standing 15 feet tall  inhabits snowy or mountainous terrain.
Beautiful pale woman with dark hair no legs and a transparent appearance. Glides in blizzards  killing travelers with icy breath.
Giant cat that kills and eats kids that don't have new clothes for Christmas. About the size of a house.
Corpse reanimated through magic or other means. Usually to serve the magician against their will.
